meanings.sent1: The tiny bell made a soft ping when it was struck.
meanings.sent2: I heard a ping as the metal spoon hit the glass.
meanings.sent3: The ping of the microwave signaled that my popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent4: The ping of the pinball machine echoed through the arcade.
meanings.sent5: The ping of the wind chimes filled the garden with music.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, short, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally poked the balloon, causing it to ping loudly.
meanings.sent2: The metal ruler will ping if you flick it with your finger.
meanings.sent3: The spoon pinged against the bowl, making a musical noise.
meanings.sent4: The glass bottle pinged as it rolled off the table and hit the floor.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops pinged against the window during the storm.

meanings.definition: To send a quick, short message to a computer or network device to check for a response.
meanings.sent1: I will ping the server to see if it is responding to requests.
meanings.sent2: The IT technician needs to ping the network to troubleshoot the issue.
meanings.sent3: I decided to ping my friend online to ask about the party.
meanings.sent4: The program will automatically ping the devices to ensure connectivity.
meanings.sent5: The system administrator will ping the devices to monitor network health.
